BTW: my tweets from today are from panels at the william james foundation annual gathering - all lessons shared by others or my reflections
#wjfdn invstrs will respect you if you make it clear that you want to use your time well/not go crazy trying to raise money that ain't there
#wjfdn (doesn't hurt if it's a flash drive you don't mind giving away)
#wjfdn never a bad idea to keep your docs (inc. investor presentation) on you at all times on a flash drive
#wjfdn: Lying in due dilligence. REAALLLLLY bad idea. #obviousbutimportantpointsoftheweek
#wjfdn: even in terms of investors you take, you may be judged by the company you keep - do your diligence on them!
#wjfdn: even in terms of investors you take, you may be judged by the company you keep - do your diligence on them!
#wjfdn very true lesson: if you want to share with angel inv., don't BS - share exactly what you have to offer and how you want to connect.
#wjfdn very true lesson: if you want to share with angel inv., don't BS - share exactly what you have to offer and how you want to connect.
#wjfdn obvious but important fact of week: angel investors don't like surprises. Except, maybe, if you get on oprah. or win a million bucks.
